parse: Conjunction
str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

parse: Conjunction
str2: Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.

parse: Adjective - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: From apo and luo; to free fully, i.e. relieve, release, dismiss, or let die, pardon or divorce.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Noun - Accusative Feminine Singular
str2: A woman, wife, my lady. Probably from the base of ginomai; a woman; specially, a wife.

parse: Preposition
str2: From para and ektos; near outside, i.e. Besides.

parse: Noun - Genitive Masculine Singular
str2: From lego; something said; by implication, a topic, also reasoning or motive; by extension, a computation; specially, the Divine Expression.

parse: Noun - Genitive Feminine Singular
str2: Fornication, whoredom; met: idolatry. From porneuo; harlotry; figuratively, idolatry.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (a) I make, manufacture, construct, (b) I do, act, cause. Apparently a prolonged form of an obsolete primary; to make or do.

parse: Verb - Aorist Infinitive Passive
str2: To commit adultery (of a man with a married woman, but also of a married man). From moichos; to commit adultery.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Feminine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Conjunction
str2: And, even, also, namely.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: Who, which, what, that.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To marry, used of either sex. From gamos; to wed.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Accusative Feminine Singular
str2: From apo and luo; to free fully, i.e. relieve, release, dismiss, or let die, pardon or divorce.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To commit adultery, not only of a married woman but of a married man. From moichos; to commit adultery.
